availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert C. Burritt (Railroad worker and pvt. 3rd FL (CSA) and 1st Ky Lt Artillery (usa))

body.p: Railroad worker and soldier. Rochester, New York, native. Served in the 3rd Florida Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private from September 19, 1861. Captured in Kentucky on September 12, 1863. Signed a loyalty oath to the U.S. government on September 23, 1863. Served in the 1st Kentucky Light Artillery Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from October 6, 1863, to April 5, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0148.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Florida, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0046.
